intro: Jatropha riojae, commonly known as the Rioja Croton, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, colorful leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
